attributes.action: Enforce and update the laws about dog-fighting!
attributes.additional_details: The maximum penalty for such offenses is 6 months imprisonment and/or a £5,000 fine and the court can order the owner be deprived of ownership of the dog and banned from owning or keeping another dog. Stiffer prison sentences, financial penalties and a lifelong ban on keeping animals are necessary.
attributes.background: Under Section 8 of the 2006 Animal Welfare Act, it is unlawful to cause a dog fight, to be involved in the organisation of a dog fight or to make or accept a bet on a fight, as well as to keep or train an animal for use in a dog fight.

rejection.details:
